mlflex.helper
Class FileUtilities

java.lang.Object
  mlflex.helper.FileUtilities

public class FileUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides helper methods for reading, writing, updating, and deleting files.

Author:
Stephen Piccolo

ConcatenateFiles

public static void ConcatenateFiles(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> inFilePaths,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> inFileDescriptions,
                                    java.lang.String outFilePath,
                                    java.lang.String headerComment)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Concatenates multiple text files. It also can add a description before each file as well as an overall header describing the output file.

Parameters:
inFilePaths - Input paths that will be combined
inFileDescriptions - An optional description for each input file
outFilePath - Path to the output file that will be created
headerComment - An optional comment that will be placed at the top of the output file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

CreateDirectoryIfNotExists

public static java.lang.String CreateDirectoryIfNotExists(java.lang.String dirPath)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Checks whether a directory currently exists. If not, it (and any parent directories that don't exist) are attempted to be created.

Parameters:
dirPath - Absolute directory path
Returns:
Absolute directory path
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

CreateDirectoryNoFatalError

public static boolean CreateDirectoryNoFatalError(java.lang.String directoryPath)
Creates a directory. If an error occurs while creating the directory, an exception is not thrown. It is understood that sometimes directories are attempted to be created when another thread is also trying to create it, and this sometimes is not considered problematic.

Parameters:
directoryPath - Absolute directory path

GetFilesInDirectorySorted

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> GetFilesInDirectorySorted(java.lang.String dirPath)
                                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
This method searches a directory for the files that match the specified pattern. After finding any matching files, it sorts the files by file name and accounts for numeric values properly in the sorting.

Parameters:
dirPath - Directory to be searched
Returns:
Sorted list of files found
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                                                                          java.lang.String filePattern)

Parameters:
dirPath - Directory to be searched
filePattern - File pattern to be searched for (can include wildcards)
Returns:
Sorted list of files found
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

RemoveFileExtension

public static java.lang.String RemoveFileExtension(java.lang.String filePath)

Returns:
